Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery wine-jar, the fabric is light-brown in section and contains many small white inclusions, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as wine of year 2.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:26/239 North Suburb, South Eastern Quarter, House V.36.1.
Curator's comments: Frankfort & Pendlebury, City of Akhenaten 2:12, pl. LVIII, fig.11.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393485) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393485)
